intro: Cheilanthes duthiei, commonly known as the Duthie's rock fern, is a terrestrial fern species native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, rosette-like growth habit. The plant features lance-shaped, leathery fronds that are typically gray-green in color, adapted to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It thrives in rocky crevices and sandy soils, showcasing a high degree of drought tolerance. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is often of interest to botanists and succulent enthusiasts.
